annocheck.message: annocheck 'hardened' test fails for /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0 on x86_64
annocheck.details:
annocheck: Version 9.50.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: warn: Could not find separate debug file: libasan.so.6.0.0-10.2.1-8.2.el8.x86_64.debug.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: info: Notes produced by assembler plugin version 1
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: info: Notes produced by gcc plugin version 9.50
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: info: Set binary producer to GCC version 8.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: warn: Could not find separate debug file: libasan.so.6.0.0-10.2.1-8.2.el8.x86_64.debug.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: look: (addr range: 0xf4410..0xf4422): Compiled without -flto.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: No gaps found.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: skip: Test for -Wl,-z-now.  (Dynamic segment present, but no dynamic relocations found).
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: skip: Branch protection.  (Not an AArch64 binary).
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: Compiled with -fcf-protection.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: One dynamic section/segment found.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: skip: Test of dynamic tags.  (AArch64 specific).
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: skip: Entry point instruction is ENDBR.  (Not an executable).
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: Compiled with -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE=2.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: Compiled with -D_GLIBCXX_ASSERTIONS.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: skip: Test for -Wl,-z,relro.  (No dynamic relocations).
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: Stack not executable.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: skip: The LTO setting was not recorded (probably due to the use of an old version of the annobin plugin).
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: Compiled with sufficient optimization.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: Compiled with PIC/PIE.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: Compiled as a position independent binary.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: FAIL: Control flow protection has been enabled for only some parts of the binary.  Other parts (probably assembler sources) are missing the protection, and without it global control flow protection cannot be enabled.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: DT_RPATH/DT_RUNPATH absent or rooted at /usr.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: No RWX segments found.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: Consistent use of the -fshort-enum option.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: Compiled with -fstack-clash-protection.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: Compiled with sufficient stack protection.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: skip: Test for stack realignment support.  (Only needed on i686 binaries).
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: No text relocations found.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: No thread cancellation problems.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: Compiled with either -Wall and/or -Wformat-security.
Hardened: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0: PASS: GOT/PLT relocations are read only.

bad-functions.message: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0 may use forbidden functions on x86_64
bad-functions.details:
Forbidden function symbols found:
	gethostbyaddr
	gethostbyname
	gethostbyname2
	inet_aton
bad-functions.remedy: Forbidden symbols were found in an ELF file in the package.  The configuration settings for rpminspect indicate the named symbols are forbidden in packages.  If this is deliberate, you may want to disable the badfuncs inspection.  If it is not deliberate, check the man pages for the named symbols to see what API functions have replaced the forbidden symbols.  Usually a function is marked as deprecated but still provided in order to allow for backwards compatibility.  Whenever possible the deprecated functions should not be used.

runpath.message: /usr/lib64/libasan.so.6.0.0 has an invalid-looking DT_RPATH on x86_64: /opt/rh/gcc-toolset-10/root/usr/lib/../lib64
runpath.remedy: Either DT_RPATH or DT_RUNPATH properties were found on ELF shared objects in this package.  The use of DT_RPATH and DT_RUNPATH is discouraged except in certain situations.  Check to see that you a disabling rpath during the %build stage of the spec file.  If you are unable to do this easily, you can try using a program such as patchelf to remove these properties from the ELF files.
